Events.year: 919 – The nobles of Franconia and Saxony elect Henry the Fowler at the Imperial Diet in Fritzlar as king of the East Frankish Kingdom.
Events.html: 919 – The nobles of Franconia and Saxony elect Henry the Fowler at the Imperial Diet in Fritzlar as king of the East Frankish Kingdom.

Events.year: 1218 – The Fifth Crusade leaves Acre for Egypt.
Events.html: 1218 – The Fifth Crusade leaves Acre for Egypt.

Events.year: 1276 – Magnus Ladulås is crowned King of Sweden in Uppsala Cathedral.
Events.html: 1276 – Magnus Ladulås is crowned King of Sweden in Uppsala Cathedral.

Events.year: 1487 – The ten-year-old Lambert Simnel is crowned in Christ Church Cathedral, Dublin, Ireland, with the name of Edward VI in a bid to threaten King Henry VII's reign.
Events.html: 1487 – The ten-year-old Lambert Simnel is crowned in Christ Church Cathedral, Dublin, Ireland, with the name of Edward VI in a bid to threaten King Henry VII's reign.

Events.year: 1567 – Erik XIV of Sweden and his guards murder five incarcerated Swedish nobles.
Events.html: 1567 – Erik XIV of Sweden and his guards murder five incarcerated Swedish nobles.

Events.year: 1595 – Nomenclator of Leiden University Library appears, the first printed catalog of an institutional library.
Events.html: 1595 – Nomenclator of Leiden University Library appears, the first printed catalog of an institutional library.

Events.year: 1607 – 100 English settlers disembark in Jamestown, the first permanent English colony in America.
Events.html: 1607 – 100 English settlers disembark in Jamestown, the first permanent English colony in America.

Events.year: 1621 – The Protestant Union is formally dissolved.
Events.html: 1621 – The Protestant Union is formally dissolved.

Events.year: 1626 – Peter Minuit buys Manhattan.
Events.html: 1626 – Peter Minuit buys Manhattan.

Events.year: 1667 – The French Royal Army crosses the border into the Spanish Netherlands, starting the War of Devolution opposing France to the Spanish Empire and the Triple Alliance.
Events.html: 1667 – The French Royal Army crosses the border into the Spanish Netherlands, starting the War of Devolution opposing France to the Spanish Empire and the Triple Alliance.

Events.year: 1683 – The Ashmolean Museum in Oxford, England, opens as the world's first university museum.
Events.html: 1683 – The Ashmolean Museum in Oxford, England, opens as the world's first university museum.

Events.year: 1689 – The English Parliament passes the Act of Toleration protecting dissenting Protestants but excluding Roman Catholics.
Events.html: 1689 – The English Parliament passes the Act of Toleration protecting dissenting Protestants but excluding Roman Catholics.

Events.year: 1738 – John Wesley is converted, essentially launching the Methodist movement; the day is celebrated annually by Methodists as Aldersgate Day and a church service is generally held on the preceding Sunday.
Events.html: 1738 – John Wesley is converted, essentially launching the Methodist movement; the day is celebrated annually by Methodists as Aldersgate Day and a church service is generally held on the preceding Sunday.

Events.year: 1798 – The Irish Rebellion of 1798 led by the United Irishmen against British rule begins.
Events.html: 1798 – The Irish Rebellion of 1798 led by the United Irishmen against British rule begins.

Events.year: 1813 – South American independence leader Simón Bolívar enters Mérida, leading the invasion of Venezuela, and is proclaimed El Libertador ("The Liberator").
Events.html: 1813 – South American independence leader Simón Bolívar enters Mérida, leading the invasion of Venezuela, and is proclaimed El Libertador ("The Liberator").

Events.year: 1822 – Battle of Pichincha: Antonio José de Sucre secures the independence of the Presidency of Quito.
Events.html: 1822 – Battle of Pichincha: Antonio José de Sucre secures the independence of the Presidency of Quito.

Events.year: 1830 – "Mary Had a Little Lamb" by Sarah Josepha Hale is published.
Events.html: 1830 – "Mary Had a Little Lamb" by Sarah Josepha Hale is published.

Events.year: 1832 – The First Kingdom of Greece is declared in the London Conference.
Events.html: 1832 – The First Kingdom of Greece is declared in the London Conference.

Events.year: 1844 – Samuel Morse sends the message "What hath God wrought" (a biblical quotation, Numbers 23:23) from a committee room in the United States Capitol to his assistant, Alfred Vail, in Baltimore, Maryland, to inaugurate a commercial telegraph line between Baltimore and Washington D.C.
Events.html: 1844 – Samuel Morse sends the message "What hath God wrought" (a biblical quotation, Numbers 23:23) from a committee room in the United States Capitol to his assistant, Alfred Vail, in Baltimore, Maryland, to inaugurate a commercial telegraph line between Baltimore and Washington D.C.

Events.year: 1856 – John Brown and his men kill five slavery supporters at Pottawatomie Creek, Kansas.
Events.html: 1856 – John Brown and his men kill five slavery supporters at Pottawatomie Creek, Kansas.

Events.year: 1861 – American Civil War: Union troops occupy Alexandria, Virginia.
Events.html: 1861 – American Civil War: Union troops occupy Alexandria, Virginia.

Events.year: 1883 – The Brooklyn Bridge in New York City is opened to traffic after 14 years of construction.
Events.html: 1883 – The Brooklyn Bridge in New York City is opened to traffic after 14 years of construction.

Events.year: 1900 – Second Boer War: The United Kingdom annexes the Orange Free State.
Events.html: 1900 – Second Boer War: The United Kingdom annexes the Orange Free State.

Events.year: 1915 – World War I: Italy declares war on Austria-Hungary, joining the conflict on the side of the Allies.
Events.html: 1915 – World War I: Italy declares war on Austria-Hungary, joining the conflict on the side of the Allies.

Events.year: 1930 – Amy Johnson lands in Darwin, Northern Territory, becoming the first woman to fly solo from England to Australia (she left on May 5 for the 11,000 mile flight).
Events.html: 1930 – Amy Johnson lands in Darwin, Northern Territory, becoming the first woman to fly solo from England to Australia (she left on May 5 for the 11,000 mile flight).

Events.year: 1935 – The first night game in Major League Baseball history is played in Cincinnati, Ohio, with the Cincinnati Reds beating the Philadelphia Phillies 2-1 at Crosley Field.
Events.html: 1935 – The first night game in Major League Baseball history is played in Cincinnati, Ohio, with the Cincinnati Reds beating the Philadelphia Phillies 2-1 at Crosley Field.

Events.year: 1940 – Igor Sikorsky performs the first successful single-rotor helicopter flight.
Events.html: 1940 – Igor Sikorsky performs the first successful single-rotor helicopter flight.

Events.year: 1940   – Acting on the orders of Soviet leader Joseph Stalin, NKVD agent Iosif Grigulevich orchestrates an unsuccessful assassination attempt on exiled Russian revolutionary Leon Trotsky in Coyoacán, Mexico.
Events.html: 1940 – Acting on the orders of Soviet leader Joseph Stalin, NKVD agent Iosif Grigulevich orchestrates an unsuccessful assassination attempt on exiled Russian revolutionary Leon Trotsky in Coyoacán, Mexico.

Events.year: 1941 – World War II: In the Battle of the Atlantic, the German Battleship Bismarck sinks then-pride of the Royal Navy, HMS Hood, killing all but three crewmen.
Events.html: 1941 – World War II: In the Battle of the Atlantic, the German Battleship Bismarck sinks then-pride of the Royal Navy, HMS Hood, killing all but three crewmen.

Events.year: 1948 – Arab-Israeli War: Egypt captures the Israeli kibbutz of Yad Mordechai, but the five-day effort gives Israeli forces time to prepare enough to stop the Egyptian advance a week later.
Events.html: 1948 – Arab-Israeli War: Egypt captures the Israeli kibbutz of Yad Mordechai, but the five-day effort gives Israeli forces time to prepare enough to stop the Egyptian advance a week later.

Events.year: 1956 – The first Eurovision Song Contest is held in Lugano, Switzerland.
Events.html: 1956 – The first Eurovision Song Contest is held in Lugano, Switzerland.

Events.year: 1958 – United Press International is formed through a merger of the United Press and the International News Service.
Events.html: 1958 – United Press International is formed through a merger of the United Press and the International News Service.

Events.year: 1960 – Following the 1960 Valdivia earthquake, the largest ever recorded earthquake, Cordón Caulle begins to erupt.
Events.html: 1960 – Following the 1960 Valdivia earthquake, the largest ever recorded earthquake, Cordón Caulle begins to erupt.

Events.year: 1961 – American civil rights movement: Freedom Riders are arrested in Jackson, Mississippi, for "disturbing the peace" after disembarking from their bus.
Events.html: 1961 – American civil rights movement: Freedom Riders are arrested in Jackson, Mississippi, for "disturbing the peace" after disembarking from their bus.

Events.year: 1962 – Project Mercury: American astronaut Scott Carpenter orbits the Earth three times in the Aurora 7 space capsule.
Events.html: 1962 – Project Mercury: American astronaut Scott Carpenter orbits the Earth three times in the Aurora 7 space capsule.

Events.year: 1967 – Egypt imposes a blockade and siege of the Red Sea coast of Israel.
Events.html: 1967 – Egypt imposes a blockade and siege of the Red Sea coast of Israel.

Events.year: 1976 – The Judgment of Paris takes place in France, launching California as a worldwide force in the production of quality wine.
Events.html: 1976 – The Judgment of Paris takes place in France, launching California as a worldwide force in the production of quality wine.

Events.year: 1981 – Ecuadorian president Jaime Roldós Aguilera, his wife, and his presidential committee die in an aircraft accident while travelling from Quito to Zapotillo minutes after the president gave a famous speech regarding the 24 de mayo anniversary of the Battle of Pichincha.
Events.html: 1981 – Ecuadorian president Jaime Roldós Aguilera, his wife, and his presidential committee die in an aircraft accident while travelling from Quito to Zapotillo minutes after the president gave a famous speech regarding the 24 de mayo anniversary of the Battle of Pichincha.

Events.year: 1982 – Liberation of Khorramshahr: Iranians recapture of the port city of Khorramshahr from the Iraqis during the Iran-Iraq War.
Events.html: 1982 – Liberation of Khorramshahr: Iranians recapture of the port city of Khorramshahr from the Iraqis during the Iran-Iraq War.

Events.year: 1988 – Section 28 of the United Kingdom's Local Government Act 1988, a controversial amendment stating that a local authority cannot intentionally promote homosexuality, is enacted.
Events.html: 1988 – Section 28 of the United Kingdom's Local Government Act 1988, a controversial amendment stating that a local authority cannot intentionally promote homosexuality, is enacted.

Events.year: 1991 – Israel conducts Operation Solomon, evacuating Ethiopian Jews to Israel.
Events.html: 1991 – Israel conducts Operation Solomon, evacuating Ethiopian Jews to Israel.

Events.year: 1992 – The last Thai dictator, General Suchinda Kraprayoon, resigns following pro-democracy protests.
Events.html: 1992 – The last Thai dictator, General Suchinda Kraprayoon, resigns following pro-democracy protests.

Events.year: 1992   – The ethnic cleansing in Kozarac, Bosnia and Herzegovina begins when Serbian militia and police forces enter the town.
Events.html: 1992 – The ethnic cleansing in Kozarac, Bosnia and Herzegovina begins when Serbian militia and police forces enter the town.

Events.year: 1993 – Eritrea gains its independence from Ethiopia.
Events.html: 1993 – Eritrea gains its independence from Ethiopia.

Events.year: 1994 – Four men convicted of bombing the World Trade Center in New York in 1993 are each sentenced to 240 years in prison.
Events.html: 1994 – Four men convicted of bombing the World Trade Center in New York in 1993 are each sentenced to 240 years in prison.

Events.year: 1999 – The International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia in The Hague, Netherlands indicts Slobodan Milošević and four others for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed in Kosovo.
Events.html: 1999 – The International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia in The Hague, Netherlands indicts Slobodan Milošević and four others for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed in Kosovo.

links.title: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia

Events.year: 2000 – Israeli troops withdraw from southern Lebanon after 22 years of occupation.
Events.html: 2000 – Israeli troops withdraw from southern Lebanon after 22 years of occupation.

Events.year: 2002 – Russia and the United States sign the Moscow Treaty.
Events.html: 2002 – Russia and the United States sign the Moscow Treaty.

Events.year: 2014 – A 6.4 magnitude earthquake occurs in the Aegean Sea between Greece and Turkey, injuring 324 people.
Events.html: 2014 – A 6.4 magnitude earthquake occurs in the Aegean Sea between Greece and Turkey, injuring 324 people.

Events.year: 2014   – At least three people are killed in a shooting at Brussels' Jewish Museum of Belgium.
Events.html: 2014 – At least three people are killed in a shooting at Brussels' Jewish Museum of Belgium.
